alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 10:29PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of Santa Cruz county including the town of Watsonville where several roads remain flooded and also for Corralitos Creek at Freedom, CA. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1029 PM PST, local law enforcement reported water on the roads around Watsonville in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Cruz, Watsonville, Corralitos, Scotts Valley, Capitola, Live Oak, Felton, Ben Lomond, Soquel, Twin Lakes, Aptos, Boulder Creek, Rio Del Mar, Eureka Canyon Road, Brown Valley Road, Freedom, Amesti, Interlaken, Lexington Hills and Day Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
